@IsaPearlRitchie Suppose the word is "inker". On hard mode, If I guess "infer" I must now guess 1 letter at a time for "in_er", and I have to choose from inker, inner, inter, and inver. I've had it happen many times where I guess 4 letter positions correct on the 2nd or 3rd guess but

@IsaPearlRitchie On hard mode, if you guess a few correct letters/positions early, this may be detrimental as you then have to use them for every guess which limits your search space. It may be better to use a word made of the least common letters, and save the common letters for the end.

@savvyRL And especially in highly specialized areas like medical imaging and agricultural where you need basically can't ever get enough labels, but you have access to A LOT of unlabelled data or domain knowledge or whatever.

@savvyRL Within the realm of small data, you especially need both. Messy data introduces biases or even becomes unusable. But you also need heavily regularized models that include domain knowledge and other forms of bias to get generalizable models.
